description.narrative: The Health Sector Program initiative provides support to the Government of Bangladesh's (GoB's) Nutrition Sector Development Program (NSDP). The program is a sector wide approach (SWAp) encompassing all of GoB's health services. It is implemented by GoB's Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Funding is through a World Bank administered multi-donor trust fund, the Technical Assistance Facility and Department for International Development (DFID). The NSDP SWAp aims to strengthen and expand the national health system, with outcomes of the improved health status of the Bangladeshi population especially the poor and excluded. The total value of this initiative is $35.0 million over 4 years, starting 2011-12.
